Also it covers real-world examples of using each pattern which is very useful practice (especially if you try to repeat pattern without any look in author's code). Nice work!

results.content:
he treatment of SOLID and patterns is not only from the theory side, but from an implementation too. Not only is this course very knowledgable and IMHO good at putting this across, with what can be a dry and complex subject, but also is very much alive and active. I do not use the word course lightly. This truly is a course, being very interactive, as opposed to frozen notes / videos. This is something which seems unusual for Udemy courses in my experience.

In detail: I left a comment about a comment in a pattern that I had found developing the ideas presented in the course, and in the same day I had not only had a very straightforward reply but the video was updated in under 12 hours to include clarification.

What can I say unusual and outstanding.

results.content:
I always wished to create or watch this type of Design Patterns course. This guy has done good job explaining comparison between patterns, providing code samples, and enough details an interviewer can ask and interviewee explain.

Tip for teacher: 
a) If you ever update that course please add some HTML, CSS to show as browser based application. For example in Builder Pattern you mentioned of shipping address and product attributes; create a form where this info is collected and show below this form whatever is collected info as confirmation, this will help students to see real world implementation they can demo during whiteboard interviews, execution of their startup application, teaching new-bees and grasp 100% skill as experienced coder. 

b) If you can add Data Structures and Algorithms to make complete project using each pattern whether within this course or creating Part 2 of this course, would be awesome.

Thank you so much for creating this course, your motto may be anything but I look at teacher unconditionally respectful as a leader, savior, parent and someone who honestly gives the best he or she has ever learned to deliver a knowledge seeker information in minimum time, maximum knowledge and experience. Just like coding best data structure, best algorithms in clear and concise manner is appreciated most. I admire your help and honesty.

results.content:
This is probably the best course that you can find on video format for learning design patterns.

Every pattern is analyzed in the same way making the whole experience easy to follow. The explanation is done in a simple way but covering many details for each case. Examples are short but really useful to see an approximation of how you can implement a pattern.

The only cons:
1- There are a few awkward syntactic uses of English on the slides. (I am not a native English speaker, I might be wrong).
2- I would like a challenge project where to put some of those patterns into use. The quizzes are good to check if you understand the concepts, but not to practice a pattern.

Overall I am extremely satisfied with this course. I totally recommend it.
results.content_html:
This is probably the best course that you can find on video format for learning design patterns.

Every pattern is analyzed in the same way making the whole experience easy to follow. The explanation is done in a simple way but covering many details for each case. Examples are short but really useful to see an approximation of how you can implement a pattern.

The only cons:
1- There are a few awkward syntactic uses of English on the slides. (I am not a native English speaker, I might be wrong).
2- I would like a challenge project where to put some of those patterns into use. The quizzes are good to check if you understand the concepts, but not to practice a pattern.

Overall I am extremely satisfied with this course. I totally recommend it.

results.content: TOO LENGHTLY

response.content:
Hi Mitali,
  Thank you for your feedback. Each design pattern takes a little over 35 minutes of time. Each pattern's lectures are broken down cleanly to help you jump to watch relevant information. Also each patterns has a summary lecture which covers everything in brief. These summary lectures are there if you're short on time and want to quickly revise. 
 The goal of the course from beginning was to be comprehensive, one stop information source for these design patterns. Providing explanation of concepts, hands on examples, differences with similar patterns and giving design & implementation considerations for EACH pattern means the course length is increased. 
Hope we've been able to change your mind :)
Cheers,
~cpc
response.content_html:
Hi Mitali,
Thank you for your feedback. Each design pattern takes a little over 35 minutes of time. Each pattern's lectures are broken down cleanly to help you jump to watch relevant information. Also each patterns has a summary lecture which covers everything in brief. These summary lectures are there if you're short on time and want to quickly revise.
The goal of the course from beginning was to be comprehensive, one stop information source for these design patterns. Providing explanation of concepts, hands on examples, differences with similar patterns and giving design & implementation considerations for EACH pattern means the course length is increased.
Hope we've been able to change your mind :)
Cheers,
~cpc

response.content:
Sorry to hear you feel this way Maruthi. May we suggest you watch few more videos ahead? Every design principle is explained in detail and with a hands on example we also see how it can be applied to Java code. Every Design pattern is explained with UML, then we see it applied in hands-on example, we compare design pattern with another similar ones for each pattern. We see design and implementation considerations for each pattern. We see pitfalls, real life examples of design patterns and finally a full summary for every pattern. We've tried hard to make this THE most comprehensive course on design pattern.
Even after this you feel that something is missing then please tell us what more can be added. ~cpc
response.content_html:
Sorry to hear you feel this way Maruthi. May we suggest you watch few more videos ahead? Every design principle is explained in detail and with a hands on example we also see how it can be applied to Java code. Every Design pattern is explained with UML, then we see it applied in hands-on example, we compare design pattern with another similar ones for each pattern. We see design and implementation considerations for each pattern. We see pitfalls, real life examples of design patterns and finally a full summary for every pattern. We've tried hard to make this THE most comprehensive course on design pattern.
Even after this you feel that something is missing then please tell us what more can be added. ~cpc

results.content:
I personally felt a lot of accent and attitude, but depth in subject are something that I felt were missing. I couldn't continue to listen to it after some time. There were phrases like, in
Luskovs Substitution principle.
"I typically do not use rectangle shape etc…I try to use classes that are close to real life application .... but  when it comes to Luskov’s substitution principle I am still going to use rectangle and square because …."

Especially,
"I cannot have a full application for each and every pattern", no one asked for it, it is his session he is dealing with it, in ways he wants to. I just felt disturbed after that and could no more continue.

Kindly forgive me giving such a rating but I was expecting to see something that Google search wouldn't have returned if I searched for it. 
All the very best in your upcoming videos, hope you could consider my views as constructive.
results.content_html:

Gives the Idea of each design patter in Crystal Clear way ; without code complications ! Explanation can't be more direct neither more simple that it's presented here! If you are a beginner like me and never used any of these before this is a good start that can crash all your fears and make you start with confidence after that you may deepen your knowledge as much as you want to expand it ; using other courses ; for me I like the flow & I do strongly recommend for anybody who want lectures that are not very fast neither very slow .
I am grateful that I have purchase this course !

results.content:
Very thorough explanation of design patterns in Java. Examples are simple enough to grasp the main concepts behind. Instructor is clearly very experienced and  I really like how the course is structured. Highly recommend. 

I have read "Head First Design Pattern in Java" and watched many youtube videos on design patterns and most are good, but I really prefer this course simply because material presented are direct and to the point. The course may seem long but you can always skip contents you know already. Besides, there is a pdf file containing the summary of design patterns and sample codes. 

After this course, I feel very confident that I have a solid foundation on design patterns and am very comfortable with :)
results.content_html:

results.content:
Excellent Course on Design Patterns from Gang of 4, with real java examples from each, use cases, comparisons with similar patterns, pitfalls, examples from java, spring, hibernate library.
Don't miss the Summary Document in the last lecture. Thank you CPC for the excellent work. 5 Star is justified.

results.content: Garbage. This guy made me excited to learn Abstract factory pattern, he showed me an example it's usage within a game and what UML diagram we will convert into code. In the end he just pulled some code and started talking about it. He didn't implement what he said he was. Waste of my time, very inaccurate video title. Most examples are not made from scratch via tracing a UML diagram, rather it's just code being pulled from lala land and traced over by him. Refund.

results.content:
Better amongst the rest....

This topic is not very easy to cruise it takes demands your thorough attention. And So the courseware should be crisp and upto the point.

This is that course. It is upto the point and crisp even then 17 hours is too much.

Pro's: 

1. Structure of Every Section (Intro, Implementation Steps, Comparison, Pitfalls, Summary)
2. Quiz Section
3. Close to Real Life Examples

Improvements Required:

1. Composite Pattern & Flyweight Pattern is poorly explained, No good example & lack of theory i suggest to redo them.

2. Need to add some theory towards introduction of Design Patterns. 
Why Design Patterns?
Who Drafted / Published & When?
How they are used today?

3. Should add section for J2EE Design Patterns
4. Few commonly used patterns / architectures like MVC

These all things are good in other courses available. 

Instructor is knowledgable & has taken significant effort in developing this tutorial.
results.content_html:
